title: Eight Sweater Vests for Preppy-Modern Style
sub_head: A school-uniform staple gets a playful rethinking with exaggerated silhouettes and energetic patterns.
body:
This spring, the always reliable but somewhat staid sweater vest has re-entered the fashion scene as a must-have layering piece for the season’s changeable weather. Sweater vests typically bring to mind school uniforms, a way of subduing individual expression. But this year designers have taken the standardized classic and turned it into a wardrobe staple and conversation piece.
Some fashion houses played with the proportions, as did Gucci, with its blown-up argyle and slouchy fit, or Etro, which shrank its version down to a cool crop-top style in creamy pastel. Louis Vuitton and Tory Burch chose to elevate their vests with geometric ’70s-style patterns woven into more modern, fitted silhouettes. In surveying the sweater-vest trend overall, WSJ.’s senior fashion editor Lizzy Wholley found that this spring’s iterations had a more carefree, tomboy attitude than the preppy, polished look associated with classic versions.
To balance out the sweater vest, add some volume by way of puffed sleeves from The Row or Sea New York or even go bare-armed as the heat index rises. Whatever option you choose, sweater vests can be part of a new kind of uniform, one full of individual expression and personal style. —Kevin Huynh
Model, Luisana González at Next Management. Hair, Michiko Boorberg; makeup, Ingeborg.
